ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Importing .cti files

Paul,

You have found an inconsistency between what the documentation says and  
what the code actually does... Replace "stoichiometric_solid" with  
"pure_solid" and it should work.  I had meant to change "pure" to  
"stoichiometric" and wrote the documentation that way, but forgot to  
make the change in the code itself.

A cti file can use any variable defined by the Cantera Python (not  
Matlab) interface.  The name "OneAtm" is defined in both. When  
processing a cti file, Cantera cannot access Matlab variables.

Dave


On Jan 30, 2004, at 8:40 AM, y2kpac wrote:

> Dave,
> When importing a certain surface mechanism .cti file that I wrote,
> the following error was returned to me.  This was on a Matlab
> platform.
>
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "./.cttmp.py", line 8, in ?
>     execfile(file)
>   File "./C-Ointerfacemech2.cti", line 41, in ?
>     stoichiometric_solid( name = 'char',
> NameError: name 'stoichiometric_solid' is not defined
>
> Here is the actual section of that .cti script.  I cannot see the
> problem.  Any ideas?
>
> stoichiometric_solid( name = 'char',
> 			elements = 'C',
> 			density = (2.0, 'g/cm3'),
> 			species = 'C+')
> species(name = 'C+', atoms = 'C:1')
>
> Also, in your pticombust.cti example file, I see that the pressure
> is entered as OneAtm rather than 101325.  Does this mean that where
> numerics are required in the .cti file, the names of variables
> previously defined/declared in the Matlab script can be used
> instead?  Should these variables be global?  How should they be
> defined or declared?  For example, is the following .cti file
> section valid? (Assume the variables Temp, Pres, and Gmlf are
> defined/declared before the importPhase() or importInterface()
> command is executed)
>
> ideal_gas(	name = 'gas',
> 		elements = 'O N C',
> 		species = 'O2 N2 CO CO2 O2*',
> 		reactions = 'all',
> 		initial_state = state(	temperature = Temp,
> 					pressure = Pres,
> 					mole_fractions = Gmlf))
>
>
> Thanks
> Paul
>
>
